pullRequest.body:
Manually expand slow `measurability` calls in various files: see individual commit messages for details.

From the benchmarking run, this seems to net -160*10‚Åπ instructions.
The `RadonNikodym` and `SignedMeasure` files each speed up by more than half (33 -> 18 billion resp. 100 -> 40 billion instructions). `Group/Convolution` is galvanised, 55 -> 8 billion instructions. The independence files become 10 billion instructions faster.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [440640d65e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13770/commits/440640d65ec678aaa68472aa182db28526f043af)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>
I will benchmark this (and a few other tweaks) jointly in #13774.

From the benchmarking run, this seems to net -160*10‚Åπ instructions.
The `RadonNikodym` and `SignedMeasure` files each speed up by more than half (33 -> 18 billion resp. 100 -> 40 billion instructions). `Group/Convolution` is galvanised, 55 -> 8 billion instructions. The independence files become 10 billion instructions faster.
Well it gains a lot of instructions, but it's a bit sad that the solution to slow automation is to remove the automation. Can't we make `fun_prop` work for these examples?
I would prefer that as well - I'm just not sure how much work this is! (Right now, I don't have time to investigate - do you?)

I guess we can merge this PR if we keep track of these automation regressions somewhere (a github issue?). If the performance gain was moderate I would be opposed to merging this, but the gain looks significant.
Please add an easily searchable substring (like an issue number) to these changes, and also to `integrable_rpow_neg_one_add_norm_sq`.

Thanks for re-thinking this! I have now created #13864 as a tracking issue and referenced it in each occasion.
(Spoiler: `fun_prop` can be made to work here, [this branch]([MR-replace-slow-measurability-funprop](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/tree/MR-replace-slow-measurability-funprop)) does it. Needs some clean-up and possibly a review if all these lemmas should indeed be tagged fun_prop. If you're so inclined, feel free to help out! I'll be very busy for at least one more week.)

Thanks!
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9534014555/job/26277933241)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9534014555/job/26277933357)
A first version of that branch is up as #13871.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - perf(MeasureTheory,Probability): expand slow `measurabilty` calls

```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>
I will benchmark this (and a few other tweaks) jointly in #13774.

From the benchmarking run, this seems to net -160*10‚Åπ instructions.
The `RadonNikodym` and `SignedMeasure` files each speed up by more than half (33 -> 18 billion resp. 100 -> 40 billion instructions). `Group/Convolution` is galvanised, 55 -> 8 billion instructions. The independence files become 10 billion instructions faster.
Well it gains a lot of instructions, but it's a bit sad that the solution to slow automation is to remove the automation. Can't we make `fun_prop` work for these examples?
I would prefer that as well - I'm just not sure how much work this is! (Right now, I don't have time to investigate - do you?)

I guess we can merge this PR if we keep track of these automation regressions somewhere (a github issue?). If the performance gain was moderate I would be opposed to merging this, but the gain looks significant.
Please add an easily searchable substring (like an issue number) to these changes, and also to `integrable_rpow_neg_one_add_norm_sq`.

Thanks for re-thinking this! I have now created #13864 as a tracking issue and referenced it in each occasion.
(Spoiler: `fun_prop` can be made to work here, [this branch]([MR-replace-slow-measurability-funprop](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/tree/MR-replace-slow-measurability-funprop)) does it. Needs some clean-up and possibly a review if all these lemmas should indeed be tagged fun_prop. If you're so inclined, feel free to help out! I'll be very busy for at least one more week.)

Thanks!

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore/perf(Probability/MeasureTheory): use fun_prop for manual `measurability` calls
